text:
If anyone’s interested in helping get the documentation site going:

<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/issues/21#issuecomment-491295008>

Just need someone who wants to figure out how to make it look decent. Some people suggested using Slate, there’s a link in there, their site has instructions to set it up. If you don’t think slate is a good fit voice your opinion in that thread. We can use something else if there’s a better fit.
I’ve used slate for docs and it is top notch. I know language support in the code column probably won’t cover hubl but outside of that I think it’s a great choice.
well language wise, if it supports jinja, then we’re fine
regardless if someone wants to take up the task of getting it set up that would be awesome, and would enable us to move on some docs related tasks
actually I just set it to slate in the github settings. idk if it’s the same thing though

and clarification to anyone who looks at that page. ANYTHING can be changed on there. I just picked a theme, there’s no mandate on having that “maintained by TheWebTech” bit that was automatically generated.

So I’ve kinda thought about the logo situation.

Here’s what I think we’ll do. We’re going with <@U7AS8L4MR>’s logo.

*Jon, make any changes you feel you need to, then either post an issue with the files on github or add them to the root folder for the project and submit a pull request to the crankshaft master(either way is fine).*

If you want to let others weigh in on tweaks, you can put it in an issue and collect feedback - you get to decide when you’re done making changes and which changes to implement. That way you don’t feel burnt out or feel like you have to make dumb changes.

---

For those that wanted the other logo. If you post an issue and can get 5 more “votes” than Ikes got(meaning Ikes total from the poll + 5 people posting and confirming they will vote 1 single other logo) we can do a revote. Otherwise we’re moving on to the code and docs for the project.
I’ve started putting together some content for the documentation site, feel free to add to it <https://thewebtech.github.io/CrankShaft/>
